text: Nepal Workers and Peasants Organisation () was a communist group in Nepal, led by D.P. Singh. It was formed when the Nepal Workers and Peasants Organisation of Hareram Sharma was divided into two (the other faction became the Nepal Front).Rawal, Bhim Bahadur. Nepalma samyabadi andolan: udbhab ra vikas. Kathmandu: Pairavi Prakashan. Chart nr. 1. In 1986 the group merged into the Communist Party of Nepal (Marxist-Leninist). Singh would however break away from CPN(ML) soon thereafter, and form the Nepal Anti-Imperialist Front.Rawal, Bhim Bahadur. Nepalma samyabadi andolan: udbhab ra vikas. Kathmandu: Pairavi Prakashan. p. 84-85. ==References== Category:Defunct communist parties in Nepal
title: Nepal Workers and Peasants Organisation (D.P. Singh)
